result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo M. Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action  - Regardless if mother wants chld support or not.  May Not have contact with Steven Herron unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
2 1/2 yrs WSP followed by 6 mo ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 , 2 and 3 - DE is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP forthwith and each count is Concurrent; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision.  Any sentence credit is to be determined by Atty Barth, which he will submit to the court for approval.  Court costs ordered and Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights given.
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
